key_responsibilities: drafting pleadings and appellate briefs
appearing in court in litigation matters
performing legal research
analyzing legal problems
formulating recommended solutions
advising and counseling House Members, committees, officers, and employees
gathering facts necessary to permit OGC to provide sound legal advice
interacting with House leadership, committees, and other House offices
interacting with opposing counsel
representing witnesses in connection with investigative proceedings
assisting in administering OGC
working closely with other OGC attorneys and support staff
requirements: excellent academic credentials
at least five years’ experience as a practicing attorney
excellent writing, analytical, and people skills
excellent judgment
ability to work with, and to provide high quality legal advice and representation to, House Members, committees, officers, and employees, without regard to their political affiliation
appreciation of – or at least the desire to learn about and understand – the role and functioning of the Legislative Branch

position: Legislative Assistant or Senior Legislative Assistant
key_responsibilities: handle work on the Financial Services Committee and other issues
requirements: substantial experience with financial services issues and substantial Congressional experience
strong writing and oral communication skills
ability to work well with others
comfort in a fast-paced environment
understanding of the legislative process

key_responsibilities: work on Ways and Means Committee issues
requirements: excellent written and oral communication skills
Hill experience and law degree with tax experience preferred

key_responsibilities: Acts as the representative for the Congresswoman within his or her area of responsibility
Informs the Congresswoman and the District Director of all happenings
Acts as a liaison to local, state and federal officials
Manages at least 1 casework assignment area
Monitors scheduled district meetings for the Member
Screens and refers cases
Prepares periodic reports for the District Director
Continually screens active cases and acts as liaison with constituents
Maintains up-to-date files on all cases
requirements: 3-5 years relevant experience
exceptional written & oral communication, organizational and project management skills
thorough knowledge of legislative process and of House organization and procedures
thorough knowledge of local, state and federal agencies and departments
knowledge of all issues and events in the district
strong political instincts, and a proactive entrepreneurial mindset
grace under pressure
ability to delegate, communicate, and act decisively as well as adapt well to changing priorities
availability & ability to work long, irregular hours including evenings and weekends
a professional style that includes flexibility, evenness, and sense of humor

office: Republican Office of the Committee on House Administration
key_responsibilities: assisting with answering phones
aiding in the execution of daily events and meetings
filing and scanning committee documents
helping prepare for New Member Orientation
assisting staff with various projects
requirements: excellent communications skills
detail oriented
working knowledge of graphics/video programs such as Adobe Creative Cloud
ability to work well as part of a team

office: Member of Congress from North Carolina
key_responsibilities: drafting legislation and amendments
tracking legislation
developing legislative initiatives
writing speeches and floor statements
staffing the Member in Committee
representing the Member in meetings with constituents and interested parties
requirements: experience in education policy
excellent written and verbal communication skills
ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment
strong team player
at least two years of legislative experience on Capitol Hill
ties to North Carolina a plus

key_responsibilities: Answer and screen telephone calls and visitors
Respond to constituent requests
Maintain office supplies and equipment
Handle casework assignments
Act as the representative for the Congressman
Staff Congressman at community events and meetings
Assist to train interns
requirements: ability to multi-task
ability to maintain a good working relationship
ability to accept performance-based criticism and direction
temperament to communicate with a variety of personalities
ability to work a flexible schedule
strong verbal and written communication skills
Spanish skills preferred
thoroughness and careful attention to detail
ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment
ability to use in-house data system, Intranet Quorum (IQ)
ability to use and troubleshoot office equipment
thorough knowledge of local, state and federal agencies and departments
4-year degree preferred

office: Senior Democratic House member from CA
key_responsibilities: develop and implement strategic media plan
manage website and social media tools
requirements: proven track record
ability to manage website and social media tools
outstanding writing skills
strong pitching skills
